result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Raymond Howard Anderson Jr was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The fine is $3268.00 due 60 days or pay plan.

DNA surcharge of $200.00 due 60 days or pay plan.

Muncipal blood draw costs of $65.00 due 60 days or pay plan.

DNA sample to be submitted.

Huber privileges subject to jail policies. 11/11/16 COURT ORDERS A STAY FROM HIS CURRENT JAIL SENTENCE FROM NOVEMBER 11, 2016 UNTIL NOVEMBER 14, 2016.  DEFENDANT TO REPORT BACK TO THE COLUMBIA COUNTY JAIL NO LATER THAN 5:00 AM ON NOVEMBER 14, 2016 SUBJECT TO FURTHER COURT ORDER. 11/16/16 Columbia County Jail Notice of Violation of Judgment of Conviction-suspend huber privileges for 14 days per Judge Hepler.  11/16/16 Per order defendant has a stay from 8:00am until 12:00 noon on November 18, 2016 to attend sister's funeral.  Defendant is to report back to Columbia County Jail no later than 12:00 noon on November 18, 2016.
and comply with all treatment recommendations.

records.addlTxt: for a Stay (Furlough) and Order to allow a stay from 8:00am to 12:00 noon on November 18, 2016.  Defendant is to report back to the Columbia County jail no later than 12:00 noon on November 18, 2016.

for a Stay (Furlough).
Filed by Atty Richard Davis
Filed by Atty Richard Davis

Cases called: 16CM466, 16CM566, 15CM136, Defendant Raymond Howard Anderson in court with attorney Rich Davis.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court went over the rights & elements.   Defendant pled no contest to count OWI 4th in 15CM136. Court found guilty, imposed 240 days jail commencing today at 4:30 p.m. Huber granted under jail rules. $3,468 fine. $65 blood draw fee. 36 mo. revocation, 36 mo. IID.   Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.  PAC dismissed. No jail credit.  Defendant plead no contest in 16CM566 to counts 1&2. Court withheld sentence, 2 yr. probation, $443, $243 costs.   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit DNA sample. Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.  No jail credit. In 16CM466, no contest plea to 1 count bailjumping, Court found defendant guilty. 2 yr. probation, $443 costs.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.  Submit DNA sample. No jail credit.
